title: Ticket #1114: Improve methods to add/remove Target scope in expressions
description:
The ClassAds compatibility layer has a method that takes an ad and modifies all attribute references which don't resolve to a local attribute, adding a 'target' scope. The method is called AddExplicitTargetRefs(). That method creates a new ad that's a copy of the original ad, but with the modifications to the expressions. We want this method to modify the existing ad, rather than creating a new one. Also, we'd like to have a version that can modify an ExprTree that's not in an ad. We also want a companion method that will remove all 'target' scopes from an expression or entire ad.

Milestones

  • Change public version of compat_classad::ClassAd::AddExplicitTargetRefs() to modify the current ad in-place
  • Make the private version of compat_classad::ClassAd::AddExplicitTargetRefs() into a free-standing function
  • Create a wrapper for the free-standing AddExplicitTargetRefs() that takes a ClassAd*, creates a set of attribute names, and calls the real AddExplicitTargetRefs()
  • Create a parallel set of functions named RemoveExplicitTargetRefs()

Details

The private version of compat_classad::ClassAd::AddExplicitTargetRefs() should be turned into a free-standing function. That will allow it to be used on ExprTrees that aren't in an ad. Having a second version of the free-standing function which takes a ClassAd* makes it easy for callers to use on a lone ExprTree.

There will be places where we want to remove 'target.' from attribute references, which the RemoveExplicitTargetRefs() functions will do. They won't need a list of defined attributes, so we will only need one free-standing function, with no second argument.
remarks:
2010-Jan-19 14:42:30 by jfrey:
These commits weren't quite what I was thinking of. I should have been clearer in my description. Here's what I want:

  • void compat_classad::ClassAd::AddExplicitTargetRefs() - Public method that builds a set of all attribute names in the ad and calls the function immediately below for each of its attributes, inserting the returned ExprTree into the ad.
  • classad::ExprTree *AddExplicitTargetRefs(classad::ExprTree*, set<string,CaseIgnLTStr>&) - Identical to the former private method of the same name, but now free-standing. It does the real work of modifying an expression.
  • classad::ExprTree *AddExplicitTargetRefs(classad::ExprTree*, classad::ClassAd*) - A convenience function that builds a set of all attribute names in the given ad and calls the function immediately above.

The first function looks good to go, but should be tested to make sure the iterator isn't thrown off by the Insert() that's replacing the current item.

2010-Jan-19 14:50:37 by jfrey:
And here are the signatures for the removal functions:
  • void compat_classad::ClassAd::RemoveExplicitTargetRefs() - Call the function below for each of the ad's attributes, inserting the returned ExprTree into the ad.
  • classad::ExprTree *RemoveExplicitTargetRefs(classad::ExprTree*) - Create and return a new ExprTree based on the given one, but without any Target. scoping.
